evidence.text:
Person A: At least tell the child you're leaving.
Person A: He knows if you've been bad or good, so be good for goodness sake-
Person B: Nanna!
Person A: ...you better not cry, you better not pout, I'm tellin' you why..
Person A: Shhh... I ain't going nowhere, baby.

Person A: I love you Elwood.
Person B: I love you, too, Nanna.

Person A: ...I hope it's a good photograph of him at least? I'm not reading The Register, they haven't said one right thing about these protests.
Person B: Nanna, next time I want to do the civil disobedience part.
Person A: Ok...shh now. Hold still. They got you good.

Person A: Nanna-
Person A: Nanna, I'll be back soon.
Person B: Ain't that nice? ... Sit down, have some cake with Nanna.

Person A: Lyndon Johnson's carrying on President Kennedy's civil rights bill. And if that good old boy is doing right, you know things is changing. Be a whole different thing when you come home, Elwood.
Person A: I'm sure Melvin Briggs will have you. And those books you were reading ain't gone nowhere.

Person B: It's okay, Nanna.
Person A: I let you down, El.
Person B: I'm okay Nanna. I'm hanging in there.
